column4: I have to register (by MAC addr) to get on the network at my school.  But i've learned that linux gives a different ip address than windows.  Any way i can set it to be the same, so that i dont have to re-register everytime i switch OSs?
Is this a static or dhcp address?
If windows is using a static address, then chances are you should set it up the same way in linux.
DHCP addresses are by their nature changing. If you take a box, get it to acquire an IP via DHCP, then reboot it and do the same, you may get a different IP. The MAC should be the same.
